Package spaces

Class ColoredSpace

java.lang.Object
spaces.ColoredSpace
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlueSpace, EndSpace, GreenSpace, MagentaSpace, OrangeSpace, StartSpace
public abstract class ColoredSpace
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract class providing a skeletal implementation of a colored space

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ColoredSpace​(java.lang.String color, int index, int nextIndex1, int nextIndex2)
    Constructor with the color, index, and next indices of the colored space as parameters The actual next index of the space is set to its first given next index, as most colored spaces have only one possible next index.

  • Constructor Details

    • ColoredSpace

      public ColoredSpace​(java.lang.String color, int index, int nextIndex1, int nextIndex2)
      Constructor with the color, index, and next indices of the colored space as parameters The actual next index of the space is set to its first given next index, as most colored spaces have only one possible next index. For spaces with more than one possible next index, the actual next index is reassigned following the pertinent player input.
      Parameters:
      color - color of the space
      index - index of the space on the board
      nextIndex1 - the first possible next index of the space
      nextIndex2 - the second possible next index of the space

    • setActualNextIndex

      public void setActualNextIndex​(int actualNextIndex)
      Set the actual next index of this space
      Parameters:
      actualNextIndex - the next index of the space decided upon based on the player input

    • getInfo

      public abstract java.lang.String getInfo​(Player currPlayer)
      Abstract method for returning the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player is on a colored space

      As the prompts vary depending on the space, its details are implemented in the subclasses of the ColoredSpace class. Moreover, the current player is passed as a parameter so they can be addressed by name during the actual gameplay to make the prompts more informative.

      Parameters:
      currPlayer - current player with turn
      Returns:
      string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player is on a colored space

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this colored space, which includes its color, index, and list of next indices.

      In particular, the representation contains the following details:

      • Color of this space
      • Index of this space
      • Next indices of this space
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      string representation of this colored space, which includes its color, index, and list of next indices
